newsitem.title: INDIA: Yield on Indian 91-day t-bill rises to 9.99 pct.
newsitem.headline: Yield on Indian 91-day t-bill rises to 9.99 pct.

text.p: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) said on Friday it set a cut-off price of 97.57 rupees at the weekly auction of 91-day treasury bills, down from 97.69 rupees at the previous auction.
Dealers said the yield worked out to 9.99 percent, up from last week's 9.48 percent.
The RBI said it received 17 competitive bids for 2.25 billion rupees and three non-competitive bids for 10 billion rupees.

Five competitive bidders were allotted bills in full and one was given partial allotment for a total of 631 million rupees. The three non-competitive bidders were given partial allotment for 4.37 billion rupees, it said.
The weighted average price of the accepted bids was 97.63 rupees, the RBI said.
